abstract: Warren E. Buffett isn’t a supporter of Kraft’s revised bid for Cadbury, telling CNBC that if given the chance, he would have rejected the deal.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett isn’t a supporter of Kraft’s revised bid for Cadbury, telling CNBC that if given the chance, he would have rejected the deal.
lead_paragraph: Earlier this month, Warren E. Buffett fired an unusual shot across Kraft‘s bow: a public statement warning the American food giant not to overpay in its pursuit of Cadbury, and a threat to reject the company’s plans to issue up to 370 million new shares as part of the deal.

headline.main: Buffett Is No Fan of Kraft-Cadbury Deal

abstract: Berkshire Hathaway said Wednesday that its shareholders had approved splitting the company’s class B shares 50-for-1 as part of the company’s $26.3 billion acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe, the nation’s second-largest railroad.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway said Wednesday that its shareholders had approved splitting the company’s class B shares 50-for-1 as part of the company’s $26.3 billion acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe, the nation’s second-largest railroad.
lead_paragraph: Berkshire Hathaway said Wednesday that its shareholders had approved splitting the company’s class B shares 50-for-1 as part of the company’s $26.3 billion acquisition of Burlington Northern Santa Fe, the nation’s second-largest railroad.
